title: Online Language Learning Design Applying Transactional Distance Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital device proficiency (e.g., smartphone app execution, messaging)
context.additional_context: Learners primarily access online learning via smartphones, with face-to-face sessions held weekly at local community centers. Language instruction focuses on improving basic communication skills for daily life

learning_goals: Learners can participate in weekly learning activities at a rate of 90% or higher on a smartphone-based platform.
Learners can use simple daily expressions (greetings, shopping, navigation, etc.) in the target language within two weeks.
Learners can engage in interactions with peer learners on an online discussion board at least twice weekly.
Learners can achieve a score of 70% or higher in the comprehensive evaluation at the end of the course.

resources: Space rental for weekly face-to-face sessions
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
